question: What is the cause of spinal-bulbar muscular atrophy?
ideal_answer: Spinal bulbar muscular atrophy (SBMA) is caused by a CAG repeat expansion mutation in the androgen receptor (AR) gene.

snippets.text: Kennedy's disease is nearly exclusively caused by mutations in the androgen receptor encoding gene (AR).
Spinal bulbar muscular atrophy (SBMA) is caused by a CAG repeat expansion mutation in the androgen receptor (AR) gene, and mutant AR is presumed to act in motoneurons to cause SBMA.
spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy (SBMA), an inherited neuromuscular disorder caused by a CAG trinucleotide repeat expansion in the androgen receptor (AR) gene.

exact_answer: mutations in the androgen receptor encoding gene (AR), CAG repeat expansion mutation, CAG trinucleotide repeat expansion in the androgen receptor (AR) gene, a CAG trinucleotide repeat expansion, Androgen receptor gene mutations
